prompt: 1. The rapid ______ of digital technology has transformed almost every aspect of our daily lives, from communication to commerce.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Teknolojinin hızlı 'genişlemesi/yayılması' (expansion) hayatımızı dönüştürdü.

prompt: 2. The architect designed a building that was both aesthetically pleasing and ______ sound, ensuring it could withstand earthquakes.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Depreme dayanması için 'yapısal olarak' (structurally) sağlam olması gerekir.

prompt: 3. To ______ the impact of the economic crisis, the government introduced a series of financial reforms.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Krizin etkisini 'azaltmak' (lessen) için reform yapıldı.

prompt: 4. It is ______ impossible to predict the exact time of an earthquake with current technology.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Depremi tahmin etmek 'neredeyse/hemen hemen' (virtually) imkansızdır.

prompt: 5. The manager had to ______ the offer because the terms were not favorable for the company.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Şartlar uygun olmadığı için teklifi 'reddetti' (turn down).

prompt: 6. The discovery of the new planet was a ______ achievement for the astronomy team.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Yeni gezegen keşfi 'dikkate değer/önemli' (remarkable) bir başarıdır.

prompt: 7. If she ______ more careful, she ______ the mistake in the report.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Type 3 Conditional. Dikkatli olsaydı (had been), fark ederdi (would have noticed).

prompt: 8. The monument is thought ______ during the Roman Empire.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: 'Is thought' + 'to have V3' (Geçmişte yapıldığı düşünülüyor).

prompt: 9. ______ the heavy snowfall, the roads were kept open thanks to the snowplows.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Kar yağışına 'rağmen' (Despite + Noun).

prompt: 10. The professor is an expert ______ medieval history and has written several books ______ the subject.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Bir alanda uzman olmak 'expert IN'. Bir konu hakkında kitap yazmak 'book ON'.

prompt: 11. Many species depend ______ the rainforest ______ their survival.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: 'Depend ON'. Hayatta kalmak 'için' (FOR their survival).

prompt: 12. It is necessary that the application ______ before the deadline.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Subjunctive Passive. 'It is necessary that... be V3'.

prompt: 13. ______ we consume less energy, global warming will continue to worsen.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Enerjiyi az tüketmedikçe (Unless), ısınma kötüleşecek.

prompt: 14. Scarcely had the movie started ______ the power went out.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: 'Scarcely... when' yapısı.

prompt: 15. The island is famous ______ its unique wildlife, which is different ______ any other place.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: 'Famous FOR'. Bir şeyden farklı olmak 'different FROM'.

prompt: 16. ______ the fact that she was ill, she went to school.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: 'Despite the fact that' kalıbı.

prompt: 17. CLOZE TEST: Coffee is one of the most popular drinks in the world. (17) ______ millions of people, it provides a necessary energy boost in the morning.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Milyonlarca insan 'için' (For).

prompt: 18. However, drinking too much coffee can be harmful. (18) ______ anxiety and insomnia are common side effects of excessive caffeine intake.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: 'Both... and' yapısı. Hem kaygı hem uykusuzluk.

prompt: 19. Experts suggest that we (19) ______ limit our consumption to a few cups a day.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Tavsiye veriliyor, 'should'.

prompt: 20. (20) ______ you are sensitive to caffeine, you might want to switch to decaf.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Eğer hassassanız (If), kafeinsize geçin.

prompt: 21. Despite its risks, coffee remains an integral part of many (21) ______.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Birçok 'kültürün' (cultures) parçasıdır.

prompt: 22. CLOZE TEST 2: Migration is the movement of people from one place to another. People migrate (22) ______ various reasons.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Çeşitli sebepler 'için' (for reasons) göç ederler.

prompt: 23. Some move to find work, (23) ______ others flee from war or persecution.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Bazıları iş için, 'diğerleri ise/iken' (while) savaştan kaçar.

prompt: 24. (24) ______ the cause, migration has a significant impact on both the origin and destination countries.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Sebep 'ne olursa olsun' (Whatever).

prompt: 25. It can lead to cultural exchange and economic growth, (25) ______ it can also create social challenges.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: İyi yönleri var 'ama' (but) zorlukları da var.

prompt: 26. Understanding migration patterns is essential for (26) ______ effective policies.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Etkili politikalar 'geliştirmek' (developing) için.

prompt: 27. ______ , he still failed the test.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Çok çalışmasına 'rağmen' (Although), kaldı.

prompt: 28. Since the train was late, ______.
A: we missed the start of the movie
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Tren geç kaldığı 'için' (Since), filmi kaçırdık.

prompt: 29. Unless you water the plants, ______.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Sulamazsan (Unless), ölürler.

prompt: 30. Provided that you have a ticket, ______.
A: you can enter the concert hall
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Biletin olması 'şartıyla' (Provided that), girebilirsin.

prompt: 31. Even if she apologizes, ______.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Özür dilese 'bile' (Even if), affetmeyeceğim.

prompt: 32. As the population grows, ______.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Nüfus arttıkça (As), kaynak talebi artar.

prompt: 33. Because it was a holiday, ______.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Tatil olduğu 'için' (Because), dükkanlar kapalıydı.

prompt: 34. While he was reading, ______.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: O okurken (While), kız kardeşi TV izliyordu.

prompt: 35. In order to pass the exam, ______.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Sınavı geçmek 'için' (In order to), çalışmalısın.

prompt: 36. However hard it rains, ______.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: 'However hard it rains' = 'Ne kadar şiddetli yağarsa yağsın'. Bu durumda en doğal sonuç 'içeride kalırız' (we will stay inside).

prompt: 37. Scientific research has shown that regular exercise improves mental health.
A: Bilimsel araştırmalar, düzenli egzersizin akıl sağlığını iyileştirdiğini göstermiştir.
B: Düzenli egzersiz akıl sağlığı için iyidir, bilimsel araştırmalara göre.
C: Akıl sağlığını iyileştirmek için düzenli egzersiz yapılmalıdır.
E: Bilim, egzersiz ve akıl sağlığı arasındaki ilişkiyi gösterir.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: 'has shown that' (göstermiştir ki), 'improves' (iyileştirir). A şıkkı.

prompt: 38. Although the project was difficult, the team completed it on time.
A: Proje zor olmasına rağmen, ekip onu zamanında tamamladı.
C: Ekip projeyi zamanında tamamladı çünkü zordu.
D: Proje zor olduğu için zamanında bitmedi.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: 'Although' (rağmen), 'completed on time' (zamanında tamamladı). A şıkkı.

prompt: 39. Many people believe that technology makes life easier.
A: Birçok insan teknolojinin hayatı kolaylaştırdığına inanıyor.
B: Teknoloji hayatı kolaylaştırır, insanlar buna inanır.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: 'Many people believe that' (Birçok insan inanıyor ki...), 'makes life easier' (hayatı kolaylaştırır). A şıkkı.

prompt: 40. Su kirliliği, dünyadaki en büyük çevre sorunlarından biridir.
A: Water pollution is one of the biggest environmental problems in the world.
B: The biggest problem in the world is water pollution.
E: Pollution of water is bad for the world.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: 'is one of the biggest' (en büyüklerinden biridir). A şıkkı.

prompt: 41. Başarılı olmak için hedefler belirlemeli ve onlara ulaşmak için çalışmalısınız.
A: To be successful, you must set goals and work to achieve them.
B: Setting goals is important for success.
C: You should work hard to be successful.
E: If you want success, work for it.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: 'To be successful' (Başarılı olmak için), 'set goals' (hedefler belirlemeli). A şıkkı.

prompt: 42. Kitap okumak, kelime dağarcığınızı geliştirmenin harika bir yoludur.
A: Reading books is a great way to improve your vocabulary.
C: You should read books to learn words.
E: A great way to read is improving vocabulary.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: 'is a great way' (harika bir yoldur), 'improve your vocabulary' (kelime dağarcığınızı geliştirmenin). A şıkkı.

prompt:
43. READING PASSAGE 1: Antarctica is the coldest, driest, and windiest continent on Earth. It is covered by a thick layer of ice that contains about 70% of the world's fresh water. Despite the harsh conditions, Antarctica is home to a variety of wildlife, including penguins, seals, and whales. Scientific research stations are the only human settlements on the continent. The Antarctic Treaty, signed in 1959, designates the continent as a scientific preserve and bans military activity.

Antarctica is described as ______.
A: the coldest, driest, and windiest continent
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Pasajın ilk cümlesi.

prompt: 44. The ice sheet in Antarctica contains ______.
A: about 70% of the world's fresh water
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Tatlı suyun %70'ini içerir.

prompt: 45. The only human settlements on the continent are ______.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Sadece bilimsel araştırma istasyonları vardır.

prompt: 46. The Antarctic Treaty ______.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Askeri faaliyeti yasaklar (bans military activity).

prompt:
47. READING PASSAGE 2: The human brain is the most complex organ in the body. It controls everything from breathing and heart rate to memory and emotion. The brain is made up of billions of neurons that communicate with each other through electrical and chemical signals. Although the brain makes up only about 2% of a person's body weight, it uses 20% of the body's energy. Neuroscientists are still trying to understand exactly how the brain works and how it gives rise to consciousness.

The brain is responsible for ______.
A: controlling breathing, heart rate, memory, and emotion
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Solunumdan duyguya kadar her şeyi kontrol eder.

prompt: 48. Neurons communicate through ______.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Elektriksel ve kimyasal sinyallerle iletişim kurarlar.

prompt: 49. The brain consumes ______.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Vücut enerjisinin %20'sini kullanır.

prompt: 50. Neuroscientists are trying to understand ______.
A: how the brain gives rise to consciousness
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Bilincin nasıl oluştuğunu anlamaya çalışıyorlar.

prompt:
51. READING PASSAGE 3: The Titanic was a British passenger liner that sank in the North Atlantic Ocean in 1912 after colliding with an iceberg. It was the largest ship afloat at the time and was considered unsinkable. The disaster resulted in the deaths of more than 1,500 people, making it one of the deadliest commercial peacetime maritime disasters in modern history. The tragedy led to major improvements in maritime safety regulations, including the requirement for ships to carry enough lifeboats for all passengers.

The Titanic sank because ______.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Buzdağına çarptıktan sonra (colliding with an iceberg) battı.

prompt: 52. Before the disaster, the Titanic was considered ______.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: 'Batmaz' (unsinkable) olarak görülüyordu.

prompt: 53. The disaster resulted in ______.
A: the deaths of more than 1,500 people
C: the loss of the captain only
D: the discovery of a new island
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: 1500'den fazla insan öldü.

prompt: 54. One result of the tragedy was ______.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Deniz güvenliği düzenlemelerinde iyileştirmelere yol açtı.

prompt:
55. READING PASSAGE 4: Renewable energy comes from sources that are naturally replenished, such as sunlight, wind, and water. Unlike fossil fuels, which are finite and pollute the environment, renewable energy is clean and sustainable. Solar power, wind turbines, and hydroelectric dams are common examples. Transitioning to renewable energy is crucial for combating climate change and reducing our dependence on oil and gas. Many countries are investing heavily in green technology to create a cleaner future.

Renewable energy sources are defined as those that ______.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Doğal olarak 'yenilenen' (replenished) kaynaklardır.

prompt: 56. Fossil fuels are described as ______.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: 'Sınırlı ve kirletici' (finite and pollute) olarak tanımlanırlar.

prompt: 57. Examples of renewable energy include ______.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Güneş enerjisi, rüzgar türbinleri örnek verilmiş.

prompt: 58. Transitioning to renewable energy is important for ______.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: İklim değişikliğiyle savaşmak için (combating climate change) önemlidir.

prompt:
59. READING PASSAGE 5: The history of the Olympic Games dates back to ancient Greece, where they were held in honor of Zeus. The modern Olympics began in 1896 in Athens. Today, the Games are the world's foremost sports competition, with more than 200 nations participating. They are held every four years, alternating between Summer and Winter Games. The Olympics promote peace and unity among nations through sportsmanship and athletic excellence.

The ancient Olympic Games were held ______.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Zeus onuruna düzenlenirdi.

prompt: 60. The modern Olympics began in ______.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: 1896'da Atina'da başladı.

prompt: 61. The Games are held ______.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Dört yılda bir düzenlenir.

prompt: 62. The purpose of the Olympics involves ______.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Barış ve birliği teşvik etmeyi (promote peace and unity) amaçlar.

prompt:
63. Tom: I'm bored. Let's do something.
Jerry: ______
Tom: That's a good idea. Which movie should we watch?
Jerry: How about the new action movie?
A: Why don't we go to the cinema?
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Tom 'Hangi filmi izleyelim?' dediğine göre, Jerry sinemaya gitmeyi önermiştir.

prompt:
64. Doctor: What seems to be the problem?
Patient: ______
Doctor: Let me examine your throat.
Patient: Okay, thank you.
A: I have a sore throat and a cough.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Doktor boğazına bakmak istediğine göre, hasta boğaz ağrısından şikayet etmiştir.

prompt:
65. Boss: Can you finish the report by tomorrow?
Employee: ______
Boss: That's fine. Just make sure it's done by Friday.
Employee: Thank you for understanding.
A: I'm afraid I need a bit more time.
D: I don't want to do it.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Patron Cuma'ya kadar izin verdiğine göre, çalışan ek süre istemiştir.

prompt:
66. Tourist: Is this the way to the train station?
Local: ______
Tourist: Oh, I see. I was going the wrong way then.
Local: Yes, you need to turn back.
A: No, it's in the opposite direction.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Turist yanlış yolda olduğunu anladığına göre, yerli kişi 'Ters yönde' demiştir.

prompt:
67. Mother: Have you cleaned your room?
Son: ______
Mother: Well, please do it before dinner.
Son: Okay, I will.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Anne 'Lütfen yemekten önce yap' dediğine göre, henüz yapmamış.

prompt: 68. It is mandatory to wear a seatbelt.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: 'Mandatory' (zorunlu) = 'Must' (meli/malı - zorunluluk).

prompt: 69. I prefer walking to running.
A: I like walking more than running.
B: I like running more than walking.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: 'Prefer X to Y' = X'i Y'ye tercih ederim (X'i daha çok severim).

prompt: 70. She can't have seen him because he was out of town.
A: It is impossible that she saw him.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: 'Can't have V3' (Görmüş olamaz - İmkansızlık).

prompt: 71. Unless you help me, I won't finish.
A: I will finish only if you help me.
B: I will finish without your help.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Yardım etmezsen bitiremem = Sadece yardım edersen bitiririm.

prompt: 72. Trees are important. ______ . They give us oxygen.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Ağaçlar önemlidir, 'hayat için hayati öneme sahiptirler' (vital for life).

prompt: 73. Studying is hard. ______ . But it pays off in the end.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Zordur, 'çaba gerektirir' (requires effort).

prompt: 74. The weather is cold. ______ . So wear a coat.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Hava soğuk, 'dışarısı donuyor' (freezing).

prompt: 75. Cars are fast. ______ . However, they cause pollution.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Hızlıdırlar, 'zaman kazandırırlar' (save time).

prompt: 76. (I) Lions are big cats. (II) They live in Africa. (III) Tigers have stripes. (IV) Lions live in prides. (V) The male lion has a mane.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Parça aslanlarla ilgili. III. cümle kaplanlardan (Tigers) bahsediyor.

prompt: 77. (I) Gold is a precious metal. (II) It is yellow and shiny. (III) Silver is cheaper than gold. (IV) Gold is used in jewelry. (V) It is also used in electronics.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Parça altınla ilgili. III. cümle gümüşten bahsediyor.

prompt: 78. (I) The heart pumps blood. (II) It is an organ. (III) The brain controls thoughts. (IV) The heart has four chambers. (V) Keep your heart healthy.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Parça kalple ilgili. III. cümle beyinden bahsediyor.

prompt: 79. (I) Summer is a hot season. (II) People go to the beach. (III) Winter is cold and snowy. (IV) Days are longer in summer. (V) Ice cream is popular.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Parça yaz mevsimiyle ilgili. III. cümle kıştan bahsediyor.

prompt: 80. (I) Computers are electronic devices. (II) They process data. (III) Typewriters were used in the past. (IV) Computers have screens and keyboards. (V) They are used for work and play.
explanation: ÇÖZÜM: Parça bilgisayarlarla ilgili. III. cümle daktilolardan bahsediyor.
